bibl.title: A Ptolemaic Canal in the Northeast Fayyum: The History of the Bahr Wardan
bibl.note: Introduction. - The canal's name [different parts of the canal had different names]. - Archaeological investigation of the canal. - Partial destruction of the canal in the 20th century AD. - The canal in aerial photography. - The canal at Hawwarah. - The canal's role in the abandonment of the northern Fayyum in Late Antiquity.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the Ninth International Congress of Egyptologists, – Grenoble, 6-12 septembre 2004

bibl.seg: KRAEMER Bryan, A Ptolemaic Canal in the Northeast Fayyum: The History of the Bahr Wardan.

Jean-Claude GOYON et Christine CARDIN (Edd. / Édd.), Proceedings of the Ninth International Congress of Egyptologists / Actes du neuvième Congrès international des égyptologues, Grenoble, 6-12 septembre 2004. Volume I = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 150 (Leuven - Paris - Dudley, MA, 2007) pp. 1051-1060, 4 cartes.

Introduction. - The canal's name [different parts of the canal had different names]. - Archaeological investigation of the canal. - Partial destruction of the canal in the 20th century AD. - The canal in aerial photography. - The canal at Hawwarah. - The canal's role in the abandonment of the northern Fayyum in Late Antiquity.
